description: Location and surveillance technology permeates the driving experience. Setting aside external technology like license plate readers, there is some form of internet-connected service or surveillance capability built into or on many cars, from GPS tracking to oil-change notices. This is already a dangerous situation for many drivers and passengers, and a bill in California requiring GPS-tracking in digital license […]
title: Digital License Plates And The Deal That Never Had A Chance

description: Would you believe that Disney’s famously copyright-maximalist lawyers have just brought us a nice victory for fair use? Earlier this year, we wrote about disgraced former Congressman George Santos suing Disney and Jimmy Kimmel after Kimmel used some of Santos’ Cameo videos (that Kimmel had secretly requested) in a, well, somewhat trollish fashion. Santos, who […]
title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Use Of George Santos’ Cameo Videos Found To Be Fair Use

description: The Python and Django Web Development Bundle has 7 courses to help you learn how to build your own sites and apps. Courses cover the basics of Django and Python and then build upon those skills by having you create your own to do list app and user authentication app, and more. It’s on sale […]
title: Daily Deal: The Python & Django Web Development Bundle

description: Turns out that when you tell advertisers to go fuck themselves, sue the advertisers who did so, and then promise you won’t do anything to stop the worst people in the world from spewing hate and bigotry on your platform, it might not be great for business. Who knew? Elon, apparently. Last week we noted […]
title: Ad Revenue On ExTwitter Still In Free Fall In Second Year Of Elon’s Reign

description: Now that streaming subscriber growth has slowed, we’ve noted repeatedly how the streaming TV sector is falling into all of the bad habits that ultimately doomed traditional cable TV. That has involved chasing pointless “growth of growth’s sake” megamergers and imposing bottomless price hikes and new annoying restrictions — all while simultaneously cutting corners on product quality and […]
title: Disney CFO Says Company ‘Earned’ Right To Relentless Price Hikes. Piracy Might Have Something To Say About That.

description: It’s about the stupidest thing anyone could claim in defense of an unlawful detention and search, but Waterbury, CT police office Nicholas Andrzejewski did it anyway. He actually told a court (twice!) that someone respecting every single law applicable to them at the point of this unwelcome interaction was at least reasonable suspicion for a […]
title: 2nd Circuit To Cop: Someone Observing All The Laws Is Not ‘Probable Cause’ For A Search
